pageContext.description: Originally a well-made casting; one end and back broken off and missing. Thickness 1mm except at perfect end, rim of which is thickened to 3mm
pageContext.patina: Silvery-grey, suggesting high proportion of tin.
pageContext.associations: Other objects in hoard, see Antiq. Journal, supra,1b. Hoard
pageContext.publications: Proceedings, Dorset Field Club, XXV, xxxiii,Antiquaries Journal, XV, 449 ff, Pl. LXIX, fig. 12
pageContext.collection: Dorchester Museum, 1934.12.16,Loan from the late Herbert Weld, F.S.A.,Formerly at Lulworth Castle, Dorset
pageContext.site: England,Dorset,Winfrith Newburgh,In coombe-bottom below Sleight Buildings (or Randall's Farm), 1 3/4 m. S. of Winfrith,Exact site lost.,1903
pageContext.toSearch: Winfrith Newburgh, Dorchester, Dorset DT2, UK
pageContext.remarks: Only "bugle-shaped" object reported from Dorset (1936). Part of the "Lulworth Hoard".,PI; CI; SI; AFI; DF(C)
